description.narrative: The Center for African Development through Economics and the Arts (ADEA) is organizing the Makuya Festival 2012. The Makuya Festival was launched in 2008 and repeated again in 2009 and 2010. The event proved enormously popular with the public and stirring a renaissance of interest in traditional dance and constuming in the villages.Main objectives of the project are : to continue the tradition of the Makuya Festival began in 2008, to communicate the challenges faces at Makuya 2010 with participating governm ent officials and performers to ensure a smoother future, to encourage newly established international corporations working in Mtwara to annual support Makuya and to trai Tanzanian staff to effectively communicate with these potential partners and to give greater responsibility to Tanzanian team members for eventually handing over of festival tradition.Funds are requested to facilitate implementation of Makuya 2012 Traditional Culture and Performing Arts Festival. The final results of the activities include : Annually secured funds from local donor sources, the perpetuation of the MAKUYA Festival, laying a foundation for cultural tourism activities in Mtwara region, Imcome generation for not only the performers event workers and Makuya team but guest houses r estaurants food vendors craft producers and transport providers.
